DataElement.preferredName: First Degree Relative History Gastric Carcinoma Diagnosis Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A numeric value to represent the number of first degree relatives (parents, siblings, children) who have been diagnosed with stomach cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: First Degree Relative History Gastric Carcinoma Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any relative who is one meiosis away from a particular individual in a family; a relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring) (from Genetics Home Reference glossary)_Chronological record of health and disease events of family members and ancestors. (WEBS84)_A malignant epithelial tumor of the stomach mucosa. The vast majority of gastric carcinomas are adenocarcinomas, arising from the gastric glandular epithelium._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: First Degree Relative Family Medical History
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any relative who is one meiosis away from a particular individual in a family; a relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring) (from Genetics Home Reference glossary):Chronological record of health and disease events of family members and ancestors. (WEBS84)

Concepts.definition: Any relative who is one meiosis away from a particular individual in a family; a relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring) (from Genetics Home Reference glossary)
A record of a patient's background regarding health and disease events of blood relatives. A patient's family medical history may be important in diagnosing existing conditions.

Property.preferredDefinition: A malignant epithelial tumor of the stomach mucosa. The vast majority of gastric carcinomas are adenocarcinomas, arising from the gastric glandular epithelium.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: A malignant epithelial tumor of the stomach mucosa. The vast majority of gastric carcinomas are adenocarcinomas, arising from the gastric glandular epithelium.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated for The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) by request of S Ratliff 3/2011 sw.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the number of first degree relatives (parent, sibling, and/or child) associated with a specified condition.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
